Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-prt] <Draeth> Here's my issue. I feel like even if the listing price was .25 BTC, we would have exactly the same conversation with any smaller exchange. The problem is, we're need 2 main things for pirate: Marketing and Exposure. Exchanges can provide both. Our "reason" for people to buy ARRR is clear: we're the most private coin out there and we have more outlets to actually use our currency than most other coins, which are continually being built on.  If I were to suggest raising .5 btc for marketing, I guarantee more people would be against that because there are less of a guarantee of results than listing in an exchange that's primarily used in a market we aren't present in.

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-prt] <jl777c> this will create a bit of privacy leakage but if you trade with a dedicated trading address and never with your main zaddrs, it will be sufficiently private. also, such a z->t leakage will be MUCH less than is leaking via CEX

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-prt] <Finality> Wonder if holding just 1000will be a huge thing by end of next year

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-prt] <jl777c> it is a compromise, but now that the anon set of PIRATE is so big, i think we can allow a specific type of z->t transactions for atomic swaps. The net result is that the BTC that was swapped for the ARRR is now in some new BTC address and arguably more private than it was before. The ARRR that is swapped for BTC got their via a z->t and t->z, so it is a bit less private, but that ARRR is much more private than the BTC it was swapped for. The BTC is of course fully transparent, so this tradeoff is a gain of liquidity for the ARRR side and gain of privacy for the BTC side

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-prt] <jl777c> compared to any centralized mixing service or even decentralized mixing service, it will be orders of magnitude superior
